runs.comm: fuller and outside off, leans forward to block
good length on middle, tucked to midwicket
that's short and Rahane gets off the mark with a calm clip to deep square leg
full on middle and leg, driven to long-on
fuller delivery slanted into the pads, nudged away to deep square leg
short fine leg catches up with this little dab around the corner from Vijay
gets the bounce that is expected from his height. A little nibble away as well, but Rahane is solidly behind it. Glides to point
picks it from off stump and works it away to deep square leg. That's not so much a risk nowadays. And also a good indicator that there isn't much swing
flashes an open face at a shortish delivery outside off. Beaten. Coventry behind the stumps fumbles a reasonably straightforward take

looks to tuck him up, but Vijay's good there. Flicks it away towards the fine leg boundary, Chibhabha is down there by the advertising triangles. Goes for a slide, but can't flick it back properly. So he has to nip outside the boundary, run back onto the field, dive full length and save it
walks at the fast bowler, so Mpofu slips a fuller one down leg. Leg glance does not connect
was that the slower ball? Seemed to grip in the pitch and rip in and past Rahane's inside edge on a leg glance. Penalised for slipping down leg
another slower ball, nice and full on leg stump. Rahane meets it with a closed bat face to find a single to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, possibly slower again, Vijay has to wait a touch before tapping to point
looks like the good luck didn't work. Presents a short ball outside off and Rahane slaps it well in front of midwicket. Looks like there's very little pace on the track
fuller delivery on off stump, pushed down the ground. Mid-on and mid-off are alert
fuller delivery on off stump, eased down to mid-off
goes wide of the crease for a shortish delivery outside off, Rahane meets it crisply with a backfoot punch. Chibhabha in the covers does well diving away

a little moment of alarm as Rahane looks for a quick single to short third man. Hasn't placed his late cut well enough for that and Vijay says No in time. But Mpofu's throw is not backed up at midwicket
length! Smashed! Plants his front foot down the line, no business moving it towards the ball outside off because he wants that room to free his arms. Powerfully thumped past mid-off
barely uses his leading hand, rather like Chatara. Keeps it back of a length and outside off, Rahane moves across to it and taps it to deep third man. Good running fetches him two
standing way outside his crease. No real threat of speed from Zimbbawe's bowlers or the pitch. Lenght ball with some room, driven sweetly through the covers
misfield on the deep square leg boundary. Sloppy from Zimbabwe, allows a second. That little dink through square leg should only have been one
banged in, but it's quite slow. Rahane waits for a sec and then pulls to the left of short fine leg. Kept it down as well
fullish and slanted in on middle and leg. Rahane was shuffling across to try and clip it behind square leg. Doesn't connect with the bat
a glorious whip of the wrists sends a fuller delivery from off stump whistling away to mid-on
attempts another short ball, but Rahane's comfortable enough to pull even from the front foot. Single down to deep square leg

Ervine leans on the square leg boundary, stretches out a good left hand but he's nowhere close. Good effort there, but this ball deserved the maximum. Terribly short on middle and leg, Vijay has camped back and hoisted it away with a pull
not the best first impression here. Although he changes his length to go full, line is way down leg
finally pitches it up on off stump, it's the cross-seamer, which is defended solidly
long-on dives, but perhaps might have done it a bit too soon. Muzarabani goes full and outside off, but Vijay takes him from there and heaves him away to the wide long-on boundary
so when the automatic correction comes, the shorter delivery just outside off, Vijay waits for it and dabs it past third man's right. Sweet batting
shortish on off stump, but since there isn't any great pace, Vijay meets it on the front foot and punches to mid-off. Seventeen runs off that over then
appeal for a strangle down leg, but I think it clipped his pad. Vijay's staring at the bowler quite bemusedly. Went for a flick, but the bat was nowhere near close
broad smile on Vijay's face as he goes up to touch gloves with his partner. He certainly enjoyed that. Jumped down a bit, made sure he was beside the ball and then powered it away through extra cover
worries about giving Vijay room, or he might be spooked by the batsman moving around in his crease. Delivers a fuller ball way down leg

in the air, but he's split the gap between point and cover point. It was a good length ball pushed wide of the right hander. And he takes the bait. Vijay's timing though helps him out. Cremer gives good chase, slides and flicks the ball back. But amid all that he moved the rope back as well and the ball ended up where the rope had been originally
fuller delivery on off stump, driven to mid-off
good length ball outside off, punched to mid-off
fuller delivery sliding way down leg. Rahane's leg glance can't reach that far
full on middle, nudged to the right of mid-on
opens the face and picks the gap behind point. Could have cracked out that big backlift and smeared it over midwicket that time. Ball had been short
drilled right through the bowler. Powerfully driven by Rahane as he leans forward, waits for the overpitched ball to arrive and connects it so well that Utseya can't get down quickly enough
full and wide outside off, driven serenely to long-off
picks the gap past mid-on, and Ervine has some distance to cover from deep midwicket. "Push, push, push," is the call between the batsman and they're through for two. Sweet little flick from Rahane
leans forward towards a fuller delivery on off stump, uses soft hands and slices it to short third man. Good call from Vijay

moves in line with the stumps, nudges to midwicket and takes off. But this is a direct hit, and Vijay looked like he was short. Sikandar Raza is the man who gets to the ball quickly, takes aim at the bowler's end and nails the throw. Looked the only way they could upset the two batsmen and it's happened. Vijay is gutted to give it all away like that, didn't think he really thought he was in much trouble. Was he taking it all a bit too easy?
starts off flat and short, Uthappa jumps back and pulls through midwicket
mistimes a pull to long-on. And by virtue of that he gets a couple. Seemed like he gets a bit of a top edge because he had camped too far back and the ball just doesn't reach
goes back and whips off his hips to deep midwicket
flighted just on off stump, Uthappa though is happy to use the depth of his crease and slice it to short third mna
tossed up on off stump, Rahane eases forward and uses his wrists to pick the gap between long-on and deep midwicket
flatter trajectory and just outside off, Uthappa is quite comfortable with a flick through midwicket
fullish and outside off, leans forward and blocks through cover
opens the face quite smartly as he uses what little pace Utseya offers. Glided behind point and gets himself an easy two
fuller delivery on and around off stump, worked to midwicket

beautiful work with the wrists as Rahane bisects deep square leg and deep midwicket. Waits on the front foot and brings the bat down at nearly the perfect time. He's combated the (lack of) pace of this pitch very well
fuller and sliding down, Rahane gets down low on the sweep. Can't connect, and the ball sneaks through the keeper's pads
fuller delivery outside off, pushed past mid-on
straight bat comes down in answer to a fuller ball on off stump. Long-on mops up
dances down the track and drills a flighted delivery back at the bowler

does him in flight! Excellent bowling from Cremer. Loops it up to draw Rahane onto the front foot and think about hitting against the turn. And then a hint of turn and the slow pace of the deck takes care of the rest. Leading edge loops over to point
flighted on and around off stump, defended
goes back to a good length ball, which turns and bounces on off stump. All of that happens quite slowly though and Pandey blocks it
oooh, there's the googly and Pandey does not read it. Lunges forward to try and block, but it pitches and rips back at him. Takes the gloves, but he manages to keep it down

pitches outside leg, turns further away. Coventry behind the stumps has no change, but the penalties go against his name. Uthappa going for a reverse sweep might have something to do with that eventual line
another reverse sweep, but again this ball is a bit too full on off stump for the stroke. Beaten
tossed up outside off, nicely driven to long-off
slower through the air and tossed up on middle, Pandey nudges it to midwicket
fired in on off stump, Pandey looks to smoke it over midwicket. But it gets to him a bit too quickly and he miscues to long-on
fuller delivery on off stump, Uthappa pushes it to extra cover
a little too straight that time from Cremer and the batsman picks him away off his knees. He's pretty clever with the variation of length
tosses it up on off stump, Uthappa is forward with a careful block. Nicely bowled

that time he overdoes the flight and Pandey has thumped it miles over midwicket. Clears his front leg and slogs it away. Reached the pitch of the ball, so he was in no danger hitting against the turn unlike Rahane
hits a good length around middle and leg, Pandey can't get under it and has to block
that's quicker and flatter - good on Pandey for making Cremer forget about his flight - and it's been clipped thorugh midwicket
flighted on leg stump, driven smartly to long-on
full and just outside off, slapped away to long-off
full on off stump, Pandey drives to long-on
fired down the leg side, Uthappa helps himself to an easy boundary to long leg. Plays a neat little paddle, makes the pace of the bowler work for him
fuller delivery outside off, punched down the ground
full on off stump, clipped through deep midwicket
full face of the bat in answer to a fuller delivery on off stump. Single to long-off
loopy delivery - ends up a full toss. Swiped away to deep midwicket
takes a flighted legspinner off middle stump and reverse sweeps to short third man
the googly to Uthappa this time. It's flatter and quicker, he goes for a big hoick. Gets a little deflection that beats the keeper as well
pushed through down the leg side, Uthappa was going for a scoop pull. Can't connect. Will have to settle for a wide
good length on off stump, Uthappa jumps back and pushes into the covers
tossed up on leg stump, a little too much flight on that to get under with the sweep. Inside edge wanders to short fine leg
takes a length ball and dumps it at deep square leg. Doesn't get the timing right because the ball doesn't come onto the bat as much
does that well. Clips the ball from off stump to deep midwicket and made sure he can get a couple out of it
leading edge, as Uthappa was looking leg side again. Just beats Muzarabani before he could leap and stick his hands up. Lovely slower ball from the seamer. That's the way to go on this deck
full and into the blockhole on middle, hammered down the ground to long-on
down the track for a whip through leg. Gets an inside edge which means he can beat short fine leg on his right comfortably
slower ball again, beats a charging Uthappa. Big slap over the off side amounts to nothing
a little short and wide, Pandey carves it away past point. The fielder does dive as far as he could to his right, but it's been well placed

slower ball magic. Pandey was looking to smash this as well, but is found short because there is absolutely no pace on it. He was looking to find the sightscreen, instead he slices the ball off the bottom of the bat to long-off
good length ball just outside off, flicked through square leg
shortish and outside off, dabbed to deep third man

that's poor. First from the batsman, who goes for a blind slog. Goes through with the shot by the time the ball arrives. Mpofu would have thought he had done well with the slower ball, but Coventry lets it slip past him as well
fullish and anlged into the pads, clipped away behind square leg
jumps the gun a bit too soon by getting down the track, the bowler adjusts his length. Bowls short and on the pads. Jadhav is still able to pick it away through midwicket
runs at the bowler, who bowls it full and at his toes. Uthappa punches it down to long-on. but besides all that, it's a no-ball. So next ball's a free hit

forehanded down to long-off. The crowd roars as the fielder takes the catch! But it's a free hit remember. Banged in short and outside off, think the batsman was looking for a fuller ball. He was on the front foot before hammering with a horizontal bat. h=Heck, even Cremer thought it was a catch
full toss as Uthappa gets forward and drills it past the non-striker. Chibhabha at the boundary does well
fuller delivery outside off, driven into the covers
sees Jadhav running down the track and pushes the fuller ball a bit too far outside off
immense power! Stands poised at the crease, just thrusts his weight forwards, waits and then unleashes his hands through the line. Kind of a whip drive through extra cover. Forehand strength
shortish and outside off, slapped to extra cover
he's doing this nicely. Keeps bowling those slower balls, and keeps getting that extra bounce. Jadhav has to wait before slicing the ball. Can't get it past cover point
that's at normal pace, full on off stump, whipped to long-on

full and wide outside off, Jadhav tries to get under it and slice it over the three men square on the off side. Doesn't get enough power behind it because it comes off a bit slowly. Hami M completes a simple catch
back of a length and outside off, dabs it to the right of short third man
hits the yorker on off stump, digs it out to mid-off
walks at the bowler, takes a slower fuller ball from way outside off and clips it wide of long-on
moves beside the fuller ball on middle and slices it through to the sweeper
low full toss on middle, slugged away to wide-long on off the inside edge
nails the yorker on off stump, only a single to long-off
launched into the sightscreen! It's length and that allows the batsman to clear his front leg and heave it down the ground. Dont think he got it off the middle. Bat face turned in his hand on impact
looking for the yorker on leg stump, Binny times it well and drives to deep cover
low full toss, Uthappa was into his lofted drive a bit too early, has to pull off his bottom hand from the shot and can only get a single to long-on
starts off with a short one, Binny swings hard. But he doesn't time it. Big hit is comfortably taken at deep midwicket. Slower balls people, slower balls for the win
gets down the track to a length ball and slaps it to long-off

dropped at deep square leg. But this was a pretty tough chance for Chibhabha. Back of a length delivery that Bhajji tries to hoick. Miscues it towards the square leg region where Chibhabha runs hard to his left, but just cant get under it
fuller and way wide of off stump...
fuller delivery just outside off, Uthappa sends it down to long-on and inspects the bottom of his bat
length and outside off, Bhajji slogs it away to deep square leg

hammered away to cow corner. Thats helpful. Gets down on one knee and heaves it away over midwicket. Excellent connection. And for those interested, Mpofu was bowling from way behind the popping crease. Perhaps trying to simulate the slower ball. That time it doesnt work
